ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot about how 3D scanners work, and different algorithms to deal with imperfect information in 3D space to generate useful 3D models from the real world.
Techniques on 3D scanning and 3D printing. Hands-on experience with 3D scanning and printing.
I learned a lot about 3D scanning and 3D printing. It's a pretty handson class with a bit of coding, a lot of paper reading, and paper printing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I learned a good deal, and the material was very interesting. The class seemed a little disorganized, and the flow of the class (types of assignments, density of homework, etc.) was very inconsistent through the semester. It was difficult to gauge the time needed each week for the various assignments.
You learn a lot but I wish that it had focused more on the papers. I thought the power points weren't too great.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you are interested in 3D printing or scanning or computer vision, there is a lot of useful information here. Otherwise the topic is slightly niche, but could be taken just for fun.

Must-take if interested in 3D printing/scanning or graphics in general. Great overview of technologies used, and final project gives opportunity for creativity and additional hands-on experience in the field.
I would recommend this class. It's actually pretty interesting and you learn a lot about how the 3D scanning and printers work.
